articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: How Coronavirus is affecting travel
articles.description: 50 airlines globally are now suspending flights to China.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: U.S. declares Coronavirus a public health emergency
articles.description: The CDC is taking the rare, extreme measure of ordering the 195 Americans who were evacuated from Wuhan, China this week to remain quarantined at a U.S. military base in California for 14 days.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Trump administration declares coronavirus a public health emergency
articles.description: Secretary of Health and Human Services Alex Azar announced a public health emergency declaration for the U.S. over the coronavirus. Under the declaration, foreigners who have visited mainland China will not be allowed into the U.S.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: First person-to-person coronavirus case reported in U.S. as WHO declares global health emergency
articles.description: The CDC today confirmed a new case of coronavirus, the first one to be spread person-to-person in the United States. The unidentified Chicago man caught it from his wife after she returned from Wuhan, China.

articles.author: Sara G. Miller
articles.title: U.S. declares public health emergency over coronavirus
articles.description: The U.S. declares a public health emergency over coronavirus. Any passengers flying to U.S. from Hubei province in China will be under a temporary 14 day quarantine.
articles.content:
Secretary of Health and Human Services Alex Azar declared a public health emergency over the new coronavirus Friday.
Starting Sunday at 5 p.m. ET, all passengers on flights to the United States who have been in Hubei province in China in the last 14 days wil… [+605 chars]

articles.author: Erika Edwards
articles.title: Coronavirus evacuations: CDC orders 14-day federal quarantine for Americans flown to California
articles.description: Americans who flew from Wuhan, China are now under federal quarantine over concern over fast-moving coronavirus in China.
articles.content: The increase, in part, prompted the CDC to mandate that the U.S. citizens who were flown in from Wuhan this week stay on March Air Reserve Base in California for a total of 14 days since they left China. Previously, the passengers had been asked to stay on ba… [+901 chars]

articles.author: Suzanne Ciechalski, Jareen Imam, Janine Phakdeetham, Caroline Radnofsky, Shamar Walters, Rima Abdelkader, Caitlin Fichtel, Ali Gostanian, Mohammed Syed, Sarah Kaufman
articles.title: Social media users document life in China amid coronavirus lockdowns
articles.description: Social media posts show what life is like in China as officials work to contain the spread of coronavirus.
articles.content: Its been more than a week since the city of Wuhan in China was put on lockdown because of the coronavirus outbreak. The virus has continued to spread, with almost 9,700 confirmed cases in China alone. The World Health Organization declared the outbreak a glob… [+3436 chars]

articles.title: Social media users document coronavirus lockdowns
articles.description: Video circulated online appears to show roadblocks, signs discouraging travel in rural China and even an apartment being barricaded by authorities.

articles.author: Fred Imbert, CNBC
articles.title: Dow drops 500 points as worries grow about economic impact of coronavirus
articles.description: Stocks fell broadly on Friday, wiping out the Dow Jones Industrial Average’s gain for January, as investors grew increasingly worried about the potential economic impact of China’s fast-spreading coronavirus.
articles.content:
Stocks fell broadly on Friday, wiping out the Dow Jones Industrial Averages gain for January, as investors grew increasingly worried about the potential economic impact of Chinas fast-spreading coronavirus.

articles.author: Yuliya Talmazan and Susan Archer and Ed Flanagan and Abigail Williams
articles.title: 'Gross negligence': Americans in epidemic epicenter say they feel abandoned by U.S.
articles.description: While a plane carrying nearly 200 Americans departed the epicenter of a deadly coronavirus epidemic in China, those left behind said they felt abandoned.
articles.content:
Benjamin Wilson, an American, who is hunkered down with his wife and their 7-year-old daughter in the epicenter of the coronavirus epidemic, is hopping mad at his government.
The American side has just been absent, Wilson, 38, said via Skype from his home wh… [+4922 chars]

articles.author: Kimmy Yam
articles.title: UC Berkeley health account calls xenophobia a "common reaction" to coronavirus
articles.description: University of California, Berkeley's health center is facing backlash after a post on its Instagram account prompted many social media users to accuse it of normalizing xenophobia.
articles.content:
University of California, Berkeleys health center is facing backlash after a post on its Instagram account prompted social media users to accuse it of normalizing xenophobia.

articles.author: Ryan Browne, CNBC
articles.title: Facebook to remove misinformation about the coronavirus
articles.description: The move comes after the World Health Organization (WHO) declared a global health emergency over the fast-spreading virus.
articles.content:
Facebook will start removing misinformation about the coronavirus outbreak from its platforms.
In a blog post late Thursday, Facebook Head of Health Kang-Xing Jin said the firm would remove content with false claims or conspiracy theories that have been flag… [+2690 chars]

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Time-lapse video shows around-the-clock construction of Chinese virus hospitals
articles.description: Workers are racing against time to build two new hospitals for treating patients infected with novel coronavirus in Wuhan, China, where the virus is believed to have originated.

articles.author: NBC News
articles.title: Coronavirus updates: The latest news on the outbreak and the global response
articles.description: Infections from novel coronavirus in China has reached almost 10,000 since the outbreak began.
articles.content:
Chinese officials say 213 people have died in the outbreak so far, with almost 10,000 people infected.
 The United Kingdom confirms the first two cases of coronavirus in the country.

articles.author: Nbc News
articles.title: State Department warns against travel to China amid coronavirus outbreak
articles.description: The U.S. State Department issued a "do not travel" advisory Thursday night, warning Americans not to go to China amid a novel coronavirus outbreak.
articles.content:
The U.S. State Department on Thursday warned Americans not to travel to China amid a deadly coronavirus outbreak that has sickened thousands of people in the country.
